level.text: A legal defense committee is a person, or group of persons, organized for the purpose of soliciting, accepting, or expending funds to defray the professional fees and costs for a public official’s legal defense to one or more civil, criminal, or administrative proceedings.
One legal defense committee and one legal defense checking account may be established and maintained for the purpose set forth in § 3800.1.
No committee, fund, entity, or trust may be established to defray professional fees and costs except pursuant to this chapter.
